cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 130 mi (205 km) SE of Grand Cayman and 100 mi (160 km) WSW of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward western Cuba, then north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico aiming for the Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast (near the Mississippi River delta / Port Fourchon-Morgan City area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None yet for U.S. coast (current warnings limited to Cayman Islands and portions of western Cuba)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None yet for U.S. coast (warnings only for Cayman Islands and western Cuba)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern U.S. Gulf Coast from Texas-Louisiana border eastward to Alabama, with highest impact expected along the Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely (34-kt probability 61%) with a significant chance (27%) of sustained 50-kt winds as Ida approaches the Louisiana coast as a strengthening hurricane.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Dangerous storm surge exceeding 3 ft is probable along the lower Mississippi River delta and adjacent Louisiana coastline, including areas near the Port of South Louisiana.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 6-10 inches (locally higher) is possible, leading to flash-flood risk along the lower Mississippi River corridor.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands and prolonged river/stream rises that could disrupt port logistics.
